Dear Sir/Madam,
Re:
Audit financial statements of

div.p:
You have requested that we audit the financial statements of
which comprise the statement of financial position as at
Date
and the statement of comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity and statement of cash flows for the year then ending, and notes to the financial statements, including a summary of significant accounting policies. We are pleased to confirm our acceptance and our understanding of this audit engagement by means of this letter.

The objectives of our audit are to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements as a whole are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, and to issue an auditor’s report that includes our opinion. Reasonable assurance is a high level of assurance but is not a guarantee that an audit conducted in accordance with International Standards on Auditing (ISAs) will always detect a material misstatement when it exists. Misstatements can arise from fraud or error and are considered material if, individually or in the aggregate, they could reasonably be expected to influence the economic decisions of users taken on the basis of these financial statements.
Our function as auditors are in accordance with Law regulating the audit profession promulgated by Royal decree 77 of 1986, and its amendments.

We will conduct our audit in accordance with ISAs. Those standards require that we comply with ethical requirements. As part of an audit in accordance with ISAs, we exercise professional judgment and maintain professional skepticism throughout the audit. We also:

ul.li: Identify and assess the risks of material misstatement of the financial statements, whether due to the fraud or error, design and perform, audit procedures responsive to those risks, and obtain audit evidence that Is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis of our opinion. The risk of not detecting a material misstatement resulting from fraud is higher than for one resulting from error, as fraud may involve collusion, forgery, intentional omissions, misrepresentations, or the override of internal control.

Obtain an understanding of internal control relevant to the audit in order to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the entity’s internal control. However, we will communicate to you in writing concerning any significant deficiencies in internal control relevant to the audit of the financial statements that we have identified during the audit.
Evaluate the appropriateness of accounting policies used and the reasonableness of accounting estimates and related disclosures made by management.

Conclude on the appropriateness of management’s use of the going concern basis of accounting and, based on the audit evidence obtained, whether a material uncertainty exists related to events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on the Company’s ability to continue as a going concern. If we conclude that a material uncertainty exists, we are required to draw attention in our auditor’s report to the related disclosures in the financial statements or, if such disclosures are inadequate, to modify our opinion. Our conclusions are based on the audit evidence obtained up to the date of our auditor’s report. However, future events or conditions may cause the Company to cease to continue as a going concern.

Evaluate the overall presentation, structure and the content of the financial statements, including the disclosures, and whether the financial statements represent the underlying transactions and events in a manner that achieves fair presentation.

div.p: Because of the inherent limitations of an audit, together with the inherent limitations of internal control, there is an unavoidable risk that some material misstatements may not be detected, even though the audit is properly planned and performed in accordance with ISAs.
Our audit will be conducted on the basis that management and, where appropriate, those charged with governance acknowledge and understand that they have responsibility:

ol.li: For the preparation and fair presentation of the financial statements in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards;
For such internal control as management determines is necessary to enable the preparation of financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error; and

To provide us with:
Access to all information of which management is aware that is relevant to the preparation of financial statements such as records, documentation and other matters;
Additional information that we may request from management for the purpose of the audit; and
Unrestricted access to persons within the entity from whom we determine it necessary to obtain audit evidence.

div.p: As part of our audit process, we will request from management and where appropriate, those charged with governance, written confirmation concerning representations made to us in connection with the audit.

We look forward to full cooperation from your staff during our audit. Our fees are based upon the degree of responsibility and skill involved and the time necessarily occupied on the work. Based upon our assessment of the size of your organisation the Audit fee for the year ending
Date
shall be
VAT @ 5% will be charged in addition to the above Fees.

You will appreciate that in respect of further assistance to the Company in replying to questions from the tax department, it is not possible to estimate the fees at the present time as this depends entirely on the time spent by the staff of appropriate grade involved. To keep the time spent by our staff to minimum we would expect your staff to provide the necessary supporting documents and schedules as and when required by the tax department.

All charges towards boarding, lodging and travelling expenses, if incurred beyond the capital area are to be borne by
. Further, out-of-pocket expenses in connection with the audit, if any shall also be paid by
.

60% of the fees is payable in advance and balance on submission of the draft report. Should there be significant increase in our work due to delay from your end or change in business model or increased complexity or volume of activities, additional fees may apply. However, prior notification and approval will be sought before any additional fees is applied.
Our other terms and conditions are attached as an appendix A, which shall be read as part of the engagement letter.
The expected form and content of the report is attached as an appendix B. The form and content of our report may need to be amended in the light of our audit findings.

Please sign and return the attached copy of this letter to indicate your acknowledgement of, and agreement with, the arrangements for our audit of the financial statements including our respective responsibilities.
div.h3: Acknowledged and agreed by the authorised representative on behalf of

div.p: These General Terms of Engagement apply to the delivery of Services by the Firm to the Client.

ol.li: “We”, “us”, “our”, or “the Firm” means the provider of Services under the Engagement Letter.
“You”, “your”, “the Company”, or “the Client” means the recipient of Services under the Engagement Letter.
“Party” or “Parties” means the Firm, the addressee(s), and/or the Client as identified in the Engagement Letter.
“Services” means the services to be delivered by the Firm as described in the Engagement Letter.

li.p: The Client will provide timely and complete access to all information, documentation and relevant individuals in its organisation reasonably required for performing the agreed services

ol.li: Fees have been computed by estimating time required for performing the services relying on the information disclosed to us. Should there be any significant increase in the volume and/or complexity of the work load due to discovery of additional information, changes in the regulatory landscape, increase in business, inordinate delay from you in providing requested information or any other reason, the Client will increase the fees proportionate to the additional time and/or effort required by the Firm to complete the engagement.
Fees are payable upon receipt of invoice which will be either delivered at Client’s office and/or transmitted to Client by email. Bank transfer charges (if any) will be borne by the Client.
Fees charged by the Firm are exclusive of VAT, other taxes or withholding (if any). The Firm will charge VAT( if applicable) and issue tax invoice(s).

If the Client is required by law to make fee payment subject to deduction or withholding tax, the sum payable by it in respect of which such deduction or withholding is required to be made shall be increased to ensure that the Firm receives (free from liability in respect of any such deduction or withholding) a net sum equal to the sum which the Firm should have received if no such deductions or retention or withholding had been made or required to be made.
In the event of termination of the engagement for any reason whatsoever, the Firm is entitled to receive fees for the services provided and expenses incurred by us till the date of termination.
There will not be any fee refund, deduction, adjustment or carry forward of unutilized hours (if any).
Fee (including advance, if any) paid to us is non-refundable.

li.p: During the engagement the Firm may wish to communicate electronically with each other. However, the electronic transmission of information cannot be guaranteed to be secure or virus or error free and consequently such information could be intercepted, corrupted, lost, destroyed, arrive late or incomplete or otherwise be adversely affected or unsafe to use. The Client has authorized the electronic communications after considering the risks associated with such communications.

ol.li:
Unless otherwise agreed upon, mutual understanding regarding handling of Confidential Information exchanged for the purpose of the engagement shall be governed by this clause.
“Confidential Information” means all non-public or proprietary information or data or any part thereof (whether furnished orally, in writing, or by electronic means), made available and provided by the Disclosing Party which includes but not limited to bank statements, MOU’s or agreements, licenses, financial statements or any information relating to services/products , the marketing or promotion of any product/service, business policies, practices, and contact information, as well as information received from others that the Disclosing Party is obligated to treat as confidential.
“Disclosing Party” refers to the party that is disclosing Confidential Information.
“Receiving Party” refers to the party that is receiving the Confidential Information.

Confidential Information shall not include information that:
became known to the Receiving Party prior to the disclosure of such information by the Disclosing Party from a source other than the Disclosing Party;
Information independently developed without any reference to the Confidential Information disclosed pursuant to this Agreement; or
Information which may be disclosed by the Disclosing Party to any third party without restrictions on its disclosure.

The Receiving Party shall maintain Confidential Information in confidence and shall exercise in relation thereto no lesser security measures and degree of care than those which applies to its own confidential information. The Receiving Party shall ensure that disclosure of such Confidential Information is restricted to those employees or directors of the Receiving Party having the need to know the same for the Purpose as described above. Copies or reproductions of the Confidential Information shall not be made except to the extent necessary for the services

Receiving Party shall be entitled to disclose the Confidential Information, if such disclosure is made in good faith:
To the extent such disclosure is required by any laws;
Pursuant to any order or direction of any court of competent jurisdiction or any competent judicial governmental, regulatory, or supervisory body; or
To its directors, employees, and officers in connection with its obligations under the engagement.

For the purposes of marketing or publicising or selling its services, the Firm may wish to disclose the general nature or category of engagement, may identify the Client’s name and logo. The Client hereby consents for such disclosure.

The Receiving Party’s confidentiality obligations set forth herein shall remain in force for a period of one (1) year from the date of engagement letter notwithstanding termination of discussions/services for any reason whatsoever.

Based on the information available at the time of engagement, the Firm represents that there are no conflicts of interest, for services to be rendered under this engagement, and the Firm’s services and employment with other parties. If, during the course of this engagement, the Firm becomes aware of facts which constitute or may give rise to a conflict of interest, the Firm shall advise the Client. In such an event, the Firm and the Client will mutually determine appropriate action for managing the conflict of interest.
Both parties agree that a conflict of interest does not arise merely because the Firm is providing, or may provide, services to other clients in the same or similar business.

An “Event of Force Majeure” means any circumstance not within the reasonable control of the Party affected, but only if and to the extent that
Such circumstance, despite the exercise of reasonable diligence, cannot be, prevented, avoided, or removed by such Party, and
Such circumstance materially and adversely affects the ability of the Party to perform its obligations under this Agreement, and such Party has taken all reasonable precautions, due care, and reasonable alternative measures in order to avoid the effect of such event on the Party’s ability to perform its obligations under this Agreement and to mitigate the consequences thereof.
The Party affected by an Event of Force Majeure will not be liable to the other Party for any failure to fulfil its obligations under this Agreement.
The Parties may terminate the engagement at any time by mutual consent in writing.

If a Party considers that the other Party is in breach of the engagement, the former shall give a written notice to the latter requiring the breach to be made good within a specified reasonable time. The Party will be entitled to terminate the Agreement, if the other Party fails to comply with the written notice.

A Party shall be entitled to terminate the engagement immediately if the other Party becomes insolvent, any voluntary or involuntary petition in bankruptcy or corporate reorganization is filed against the other Party, a receiver is appointed over any of the assets of the other Party, any liquidation proceedings (or any equivalent or analogous proceedings by whatever name known) are commenced by or against the other Party.
You shall forthwith settle all outstanding amounts due to the Firm for the services performed till the date of termination of the engagement.

li.p: The Firm or any Partners, officer, employee or representative of the Firm shall have no liability to the Client for any direct or indirect losses, claims, damages or liabilities relating to or arising from the performance of the services by the Firm, except where such liability arises out of gross negligence or fraud as established in a competent court of law.

The Client shall indemnify the Firm, its Partners and employees, from all third party claims, litigations, damages, losses, expenses, or costs (including attorney’s/lawyer’s fees and court expenses) directly or indirectly arising out of misrepresentation, fraud, or non-disclosure of material facts by such you.

Any notice to be given by one Party to the other Party under, or in connection with, the engagement shall be in writing and signed by or on behalf of the Party giving it. It shall be served by sending it by Email to the Email address set out below, or having it delivered by hand or pre-paid recorded delivery or registered post to the address set out in the Engagement Letter. Any notice so served by hand, Email, or post shall be deemed to have been duly given.

ol.li: If these General Terms of Engagement or Engagement Letter are translated into any language other than English, the English language text shall prevail. All communications and documentation pursuant to the engagement shall be in English language.
Unless otherwise agreed upon, all deliverables pursuant to the engagement shall be in English language.

li.p: You acknowledge that, for compliance and regulatory purposes, the Firm is entitled to retain copies of all documents and other information, or any part thereof (in written, electronic, or other form), created or maintained while performing the Services, for the minimum retention period prescribed by the applicable law. Following such minimum retention period, the Firm shall ensure that all such copies are duly destroyed.

ol.Li: If any term of this engagement is held to be invalid, in whole or in part, that term or part will be deemed not to form part of the engagement. The enforceability of the remainder of the engagement will not be affected.
Persons who are not party to this agreement shall have no rights to enforce any terms of this engagement.

In accordance with the relevant Anti-Money Laundering laws, the Client agrees to waive its right to confidentiality to the extent of any report made, document provided or information disclosed to the relevant regulatory authority. The Client also acknowledges that the Firm may be required to report directly to regulatory authority without prior reference to the Client.

Without prior written consent form the Firm, the Client shall not, directly or indirectly, solicit the employment of any of the Firm’s partners, directors or employees, as the case may be, involved in performing the engagement for a period of two (2) years following the completion or following termination of the engagement.

li.p: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of Sultanate of Oman.

If any dispute, claim, controversy, or difference between the Parties arises out of or in connection with this Agreement, including any question regarding its existence, validity, interpretation or termination (“Dispute”), then the Parties shall use their best endeavors to settle the Dispute. If the Parties do not reach a solution within a period of thirty (30) days, then the Dispute shall be finally settled by the Sultanate of Oman Courts. The Parties agree that the Sultanate of Oman Courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction over all Disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or agreement.
